docs.snippet: Despite threats of retaliation from China over U.S. plans to impose tariffs on up to $60 billion in Chinese goods, Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin on Sunday said President Donald Trump had no intention of backing down and was not worried about a ...

headline.print_headline: Mnuchin: Trump Not Afraid of a Trade War With China-Fox News
headline.main: Mnuchin: Trump Not Afraid of a Trade War With China-Fox News

docs.snippet: Two leaders of Britain First were found guilty of religiously aggravated harassment. They gained notoriety when President Trump shared their videos.

headline.main: Anti-Muslim Extremists Retweeted by Trump Are Convicted of Hate Crimes

docs.snippet: A federal heating aid program for low-income residents has survived another attempt by President Donald Trump to kill it.

headline.print_headline: Federal Heating Aid Program Saved, Expanded in Trump Budget
headline.main: Federal Heating Aid Program Saved, Expanded in Trump Budget

docs.snippet: Adult film star Stormy Daniels says she was threatened to keep silent about an alleged sexual encounter with Donald Trump in 2006, telling her story in a highly anticipated interview with CBS' "60 Minutes" broadcast Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Porn Star Describes Threat Over Alleged Trump Encounter
headline.main: Porn Star Describes Threat Over Alleged Trump Encounter

docs.snippet: Texas and more than a dozen other states led by Republican governors got behind the Trump administration on Monday in its lawsuit over California's so-called sanctuary laws that protect people in the U.S. illegally.

headline.print_headline: GOP-Led States Back Trump in California 'Sanctuary' Lawsuit
headline.main: GOP-Led States Back Trump in California 'Sanctuary' Lawsuit

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump is considering the expulsion of some Russian diplomats in the United States in solidarity with Britain over the poisoning of a former Russian spy in England, a source familiar with the situation said on Sunday.

headline.print_headline: Trump Considers Expelling Some Russian Diplomats Over Poison Attack: Source
headline.main: Trump Considers Expelling Some Russian Diplomats Over Poison Attack: Source

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump isn't always bringing genuine statistics to the fight as he goes after China on trade.

headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Off Base on Trade Stats With China
headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Off Base on Trade Stats With China

docs.snippet: A top fundraiser for President Donald Trump filed a lawsuit Monday against the state of Qatar and lobbyists working for Qatar, alleging they hacked his and his wife's emails as part of an ongoing battle between the United Arab Emirates and Qatar.

headline.print_headline: Trump Fundraiser Sues Qatar, Lobbyists Over Email Hack
headline.main: Trump Fundraiser Sues Qatar, Lobbyists Over Email Hack

docs.snippet: China's newly appointed economic czar told U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Saturday that Beijing is ready to defend its interests after President Donald Trump announced plans to slap tariffs on nearly $50 billion in Chinese imports.

headline.print_headline: China Tells US It Will Defend Interests After Trump Tariffs
headline.main: China Tells US It Will Defend Interests After Trump Tariffs

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump signed a memorandum on Friday that bans some transgender individuals from serving in the U.S. military, but gives the armed forces latitude in implementing policies.

headline.print_headline: Trump Moves to Limit Transgender Individuals From Military Service
headline.main: Trump Moves to Limit Transgender Individuals From Military Service
